final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures based on input data precision (1.50 A, 30.0 min)

method: Convert time to seconds: 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge: Q = I × t = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96500 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu, 2 moles of electrons produce 1 mole of Cu. Therefore moles of Cu = n(e-) / 2 = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass of Cu: m = n × Mr = 0.01399 × 63.55 = 0.889 g. Using more precise calculation: n(Cu) = (1.50 × 1800) / (2 × 96500) = 2700 / 193000 = 0.01399 mol. Mass = 0.01399 × 63.55 = 0.889 g.
key_equations: Moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F
checks: Mass Cu = 0.01399 × 63.55 = 0.889 g ≈ 0.887 g with rounding
